description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Ishigaki" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Ishigaki

places.generalDescription: Kondoi Beach, located on Taketomi Island in Okinawa Prefecture, is renowned for its gentle slope and fine white sands. The emerald green waters with a shallow sandy floor make it the best beach on the island. Visitors can enjoy laying out in the sun on the large white sand beach and swimming in warm waters during high tide. However, caution is advised as strong currents and poisonous creatures like Habu Jellyfish are present from June to October.

sources.snippet: Kondoi beach on Taketomi island is a gorgeous beach on a gorgeous small and atmospheric island. Good for swimming, pictures and sunbathing, not for snorkelling. If you want to do some serious swimming in the turquoise water check the tide online before you go.
sources.siteName: DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands - Travel tips for your travel to Japan
sources.shortName: Beaches in the Yaeyama archipelago - DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands

sources.snippet: The shallow water at Kondoi beach is so clear that it barely feels natural, and the soft white sand coils into the sea like a nautilus shell – giving you a nice spot to wade to and take photos. Even the cloudy weather didn’t spoil the view.
sources.shortName: Okinawa Beaches and Island time in Ishigaki
10 Top Tips for Ishigaki Exploration

places.name: Kondoi Beach

reviews.text: If you're looking for peace, beauty and serenity, this is the beach for you!  Gentle shallow waters that is crystal clear with nary a person in sight!  Clear views of nearby islands with sparkling hues of blue and green for a far as your eyes can see.  Been to many beautiful beaches all over the world and this has got to be one of the best kept secrets.  Hats off to the locals for maintaining the natural beauty of this heavenly place.
Visited in mid-June 2025. It's about a 30-minute walk from the Taketomi Island ferry terminal. The most beautiful beach I've ever seen in my life.

Beautiful beach especially at high tide. Warning though : the crows are very aggressive and stole my clothes and sunscreen! Lock your valuables up! Also keep walking to the far side - there is lots of shade under trees around the bend and 200m further.

places.generalDescription: Kabira Bay, situated at the northwest corner of Ishigaki Island in Japan, is a stunning emerald blue bay with a pristine yellow-white beach and craggy islands dotting the waters. While swimming is not allowed, visitors can enjoy a glass-bottom boat tour to admire the beauty of the bay. The area is known for its fast-moving tides, so caution is advised when walking along the coast from bay to bay.

sources.snippet: Located in the northwestern part of the island, it takes about 40 minutes by car from Shin-Ishigaki Airport. It is a view spot that cannot be missed in the itinerary of driving around the island.The contrast between the color of the sea, called Kabira blue, which changes with the time of day, and the pure white powder sand on the beach is wonderful. Surrounded by glass boat stores, restaurants, and souvenir stores, the view of Kabira Bay from the hilltop of the adjacent Kabira Park is a popular photo spot often seen in magazines.
sources.shortName: 八重山諸島に点在する美景ビーチ30選 | 石垣島ツアーズ

sources.snippet:
Northwestern part of Ishigaki Island 
Located in 
The emerald green sea is dotted with lush islands 
Kabira Bay
.. Travel guidebook for foreigners visiting Japan " 
Michelin Green Guide Japan
", Then

is.

A tourist destination worth visiting
". Kabira Bay has different colors depending on the depth, 
Mysterious gradation from blue to green
Fascinates the visitors.
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Summary of recommended beaches and activities on Ishigaki Island

sources.snippet: One of the most famous spots in Ishigaki – and one of the Top 100 Landscapes of Japan – Kabira Bay is truly picture perfect. The colors of the ocean are said to change with the tides, turning from shades of turquoise to emerald.The popular glass-bottomed boats reveal a pristine underwater world below, where black pearls are cultivated. Though swimming is not allowed due to strong currents, visitors can still enjoy the beach and the gorgeous views.
sources.shortName: 20 Fun Things to Do On Ishigaki Island, Okinawa - Places to Go, Local Food & Sightseeing Tips

sources.snippet: The typical postcard of Ishigaki, Kabira Bay is considered the most beautiful beach on the island, with emerald green waters and islets full of vegetation. It’s located below the village and the view from above is truly incredible!. However, in this beach, you’re not allowed to swimming due to the strong tides, but its crystal clear waters and the coral reef can be admired from the transparent bottom-boats.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island, the southern side of Okinawa

sources.snippet: Kabira Bay is incredibly picturesque and famous and is an area recommended strongly by locals. It received three stars from the "Micheln Green Guide Japan." Here visitors can enjoy the renowned "Kabira Blue" color of the water here throughout the year. Although swimming is prohibited here due to its fast tides, exploring the sea in a glass-bottom boat is a popular activity you can do instead.
sources.shortName: See Popular Okinawa Islands! 7 Activities On Ishigaki

sources.snippet: Kabira Bayis a scenic beach located in the northwest part of the island. It is selected among the top 100 most scenic spots in Japan, and is mentioned in almost any travel guides of Ishigaki island. It is also widely known for the farming of black pearls, a beautiful, valuable jewel.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Things to Do on Ishigaki Island – Okinawa

sources.snippet: The view of Kabira Bay (川平湾) is a symbol of Ishigaki Island and it is the most-visited tourist site there. You can see the emerald green sea and tiny islands floating on the bay. There are lots of nice photo spots around Kabira Bay, so take a stroll to find your favorite place.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things to Do in Ishigaki Island

sources.snippet: Kabira Bay is one of the popular tourist spots and is home to the island’s most famous beach – Yonehara beach. This beach offers some of the great diving and snorkelling sites amidst white coral reefs. Swimming, diving and snorkelling are strictly not allowed in the Kabira Bay.
sources.shortName: Best Beach of Japan for Tourists: Ishigaki Island, The Hidden Holm

sources.snippet: If you come to Ishigaki Island for the first time, you definitely want to visit here. It is popular not only for its beautiful coastline, but also for being able to board a Kabira Bay glass-bottom boat. There are souvenir shops and restaurants.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island Recommended Beach List

sources.snippet: The first thing that I heard about when researching things to do in Ishigaki, was Kabira Bay. It seemed like everyone recommends you to go to Kabira Bay!. And then we went and it surprised me in so many ways.
sources.shortName: Best of Ishigaki – Beaches, Snorkelling, Sunsets and More

sources.snippet: Lucky for me, Kabira Bay, arguably Ishigaki’s most iconic landmark, offers glass-bottom boat tours for around 1000 yen: all the otherworldly beauty without any of the ‘what just touched my leg?!
sources.shortName: Okinawa Beaches and Island time in Ishigaki

sources.snippet: Head towards Club Med (Kabira Bay to the back) then turn right onto a small road. The beach is down that small unmarked road. It's very picturesque with clear water and white sand.
sources.siteName: OMAKASE - Japan Tours, Trip, Travel Guide -
sources.shortName: My Tropical Paradise - Ishigaki Island : Blog（test） | OMAKASE

sources.siteName: VISIT OKINAWA JAPAN | Official Okinawa Travel Guide
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island | VISIT OKINAWA JAPAN
Ishigaki Island | Okinawa | Okinawa | Destinations | Travel Japan
Your Search for an Ishigaki Itinerary Ends Today

places.name: Kabira Bay

reviews.text:
A scenic spot about 30 minutes by car from the city area. Despite the bad weather, the sea was clear and clean. There are plenty of parking lots and souvenir facilities nearby, and you can also have lunch around here.
The glass boat was a content that can be enjoyed regardless of the weather.
Potentially pretty bay with very strong currents. Way too many polluting boats, too many tourists, and unbelievable amount of plastic waste mainly from Japan, but some from China.

You can enjoy the underwater scenery on a cruise ship.
You can make reservations in advance for the ship, and it operates on a short time frame.
The course is within 1 hour, and the cost is also reasonable.

places.generalDescription: Kabira Bay is a popular tourist spot known for its stunning views and crystal-clear waters. While swimming is prohibited to protect the area's black pearls and due to strong currents, visitors can still enjoy kayaking in the bay. The afternoon offers the best views with the sun's reflection on the water. The bay has been recognized as one of Japan's most scenic areas and boasts breathtaking vistas of lush islands.

sources.snippet: Here, you can walk to the adjoining islands at low tide and even find wild coconuts growing on the trees in the nearby forest. Use Google Satellite to find your own secluded beach — just make sure to keep an eye on the wind directions throughout the day.
sources.shortName: 10 Top Tips for Ishigaki Exploration

places.name: Kabira Bay

reviews.text: Kabira Bay has clear blue water and green hills… really pretty. It's very windy during our visit. There are small shops and ice cream nearby. It's a peaceful, beautiful place to stop by on Ishigaki Island.
Bottom glass boat Rides are lovely. We saw turtles and coral reefs, absolutely stunning! Besides walking on the beach there isn't really much to do

Stunning views, relaxing atmosphere. Definitely was on the top of the list for places I wanted to visit in Ishigaki and it did not disappoint. You can ride the glass boats which take you around the surrounding ocean where you can see the coral reefs and its abundant wild life right from the safety of a boat. There's also lots to do and delicious food to eat in the surrounding area. 10/10 recommend!

places.generalDescription: Yonehara Beach, located on Ishigaki Island, is a stunning white sand beach surrounded by lush greenery and bathed by turquoise waters with vibrant coral reefs. It's known as one of the best snorkeling spots on the island, offering a chance to observe a diverse range of hard corals and tropical marine life including colorful fish, sea turtles, and manta rays. However, caution is advised due to rip currents and jellyfish in some areas.

sources.snippet: This white-sand beach is a popular place to stretch out and enjoy views of the beautiful verdant coastline, Okinawa's highest peak, Mt. Omoto, and the nearby grove of Yaeyama palms. Coral reefs are found in the waters here, and colorful tropical fish can be seen swimming near the shore.In summer the adjacent campground bustles with activity as beach campers celebrate the season. The fast current off Yonehara Beach requires that swimmers exercise caution.
sources.shortName: 20 Fun Things to Do On Ishigaki Island, Okinawa - Places to Go, Local Food & Sightseeing Tips

sources.snippet: For family-friendly snorkeling adventures, we recommend dipping into the water of Yonehara Beach, especially at the southern end of the beach. Even though Yonehara Beach is a touristy spot, the quality of the coral and surrounding sea life will not disappoint experienced snorkeling aficionados. Crystal Beach on Ishigaki’s west coast is a picturesque beach surrounded by mountains, with a freshwater stream flowing into the ocean.
sources.shortName: 10 Top Tips for Ishigaki Exploration

sources.snippet: Yoehara Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Ishigaki, with the white coral reef that makes it the ideal destination for snorkeling. It is a rather long beach and if you’re leaving the area near toilets and showers, you can enjoy the beauty of the beach peacefully. In the area there is also the Yonehara Palm Tree Groove.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island, the southern side of Okinawa

sources.snippet: While it is possible to spot a few tropical fishes on most of the beaches, Yonehara is by far the most popular one for snorkeling. The coral reefs are very close to the shore, especially during low tide, so be careful as you swim. Also, be sure to head warning about currents and Habu jellyfish
sources.shortName: Snorkeling | Visit Ishigaki

sources.snippet: Although this beach isn’t an officially authorized beach, there are no lifeguards or jellyfish nets, it’s the most popular beach for snorkelling. In high season it can be busy. What makes this beach so attractive is, of course, the stunning underwater world just a few steps inside the ocean.
sources.siteName: DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands - Travel tips for your travel to Japan
sources.shortName: Beaches in the Yaeyama archipelago - DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands

sources.snippet: Kabira Bay is one of the popular tourist spots and is home to the island’s most famous beach – Yonehara beach. This beach offers some of the great diving and snorkelling sites amidst white coral reefs. Swimming, diving and snorkelling are strictly not allowed in the Kabira Bay.
sources.shortName: Best Beach of Japan for Tourists: Ishigaki Island, The Hidden Holm

sources.snippet: The beach stretches right next to the Yonehara Campground, surrounded by greenery. There is a pristine coastline with coral beaches, and nearby is an unspoiled wilderness called the Blue Cave. The beach and Blue Cave are ideal for snorkeling due to the proximity of coral reefs.
sources.shortName: 八重山諸島に点在する美景ビーチ30選 | 石垣島ツアーズ

sources.snippet: It's a great place for snorkeling, we saw many tropical fish here. Make sure to check the tides in advance because you can only swim here at high tide. There is a camp ground in the trees behind it, which we used to shelter in during a sudden downpour.
sources.siteName: OMAKASE - Japan Tours, Trip, Travel Guide -
sources.shortName: My Tropical Paradise - Ishigaki Island : Blog（test） | OMAKASE

sources.snippet: Located at the north part of the island, Yonehara is a long beach with a reputation of being the best snorkelling spot of the island. You have a camp site, just next to it and the beach is quite wild compared to the other ones so highly recommended.
sources.shortName: Discover Ishigaki, Iriomote, Taketomi, Yonaguni or Hateruma

sources.snippet: If you are not familiar with Ishigaki Island, you should definitely go. Coral grows in colonies in shallow water. As soon as you walk from the beach and enter the water, there are many corals and tropical fishes!
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island Recommended Beach List

sources.snippet: Yonehara Beach is on the north side of the island, and it is the most popular destination. There is a campsite nearby, and the beach pulses with life. It is a good location for snorkeling and diving.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island | Okinawa | Okinawa | Destinations | Travel Japan

sources.snippet: This is the beach you can see from the terrace/balcony of your apartment. Less than 5 minutes away by car, drive the opposite way of Kabira. Families like this beach as the waters are shallow.
sources.shortName: Closest beaches | vacances a la mer Ishigaki

sources.snippet: A gently arcing lush coastline, white sandy beach, and a beach full of tropical mood where Yaeyama pear (palm tree), an endemic species of the Yaeyama Islands, grows.
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Summary of recommended beaches and activities on Ishigaki Island

places.name: Yonehara Beach

reviews.text: BEST snorkeling I've had ever. We went around 4pm in the afternoon in November. Parking lot was closed so we parked st the nearby community center. The water remains very shallow quite far (I could stand), but there were so much seaweed and corals. I saw two sea snakes and a sea turtle!

We parked at the camping ground (500 yen) which meant a significant walk along the beach to the safe snorkelling area. Coral
Disappointing but good fish life. At mid tide it was challenging to find a passage through the corals and I would recommend going at high tide or reasonably close to that.

Excellent experience swimming with many kinds of tropical fish and coral reefs even near the shore! No wonder many people doing snorkelling there. There is a shop right beside the parking lot where you can rent the snorkelling equipment.
Will definitely go there again!!

sources.siteName: DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands - Travel tips for your travel to Japan
sources.shortName: Beaches in the Yaeyama archipelago - DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands

reviews.text: Hidden gem. Very beautiful little beach, we were lucky to stumble upon it as we saw the sun was setting and a car was parked on the side of the road. As soon as we walked onto the beach the other people were leaving so we enjoyed an amazing view and such a peaceful scene with beautiful clear calm waters. We were not planning the visit so didn't swim but it looked so inviting.

This is probably the nicest beach in Ishigaki. The sand is white and soft and the water is clear blue. There isn't any garbage and there isn't many people. The only downfall is it is a bit far from the city and there isn't much parking either.
The beach was super shallow all the way till so far that you won't even want to reach! You  can enjoy very nice snorkeling without having any issue! There are some fishes definitely.

places.generalDescription: Located in the middle of northern Ishigaki Island, Tamatorizaki Observation Platform offers stunning panoramic views of the bay, the reef, and lush surroundings. It is situated on a hill, providing visitors with a wide view of the beautiful blue sky and Okinawan ocean. Additionally, nearby attractions include the Ishigakijima Astronomical Observatory on Mt.

sources.snippet: On the morning of our departure, we got up just before sunrise to see it from the Tamatorizaki Observation Platform. As it was very quiet everywhere on Ishigaki, I was surprised to see quite a number of people who got up literally at the crack of dawn to see the sunrise from here. We also visited the platform a few days prior in the afternoon, and that was just as nice.
sources.shortName: Best of Ishigaki – Beaches, Snorkelling, Sunsets and More

sources.snippet: I recommend getting your car at the airport after you arrive, then driving to Tamatorizaki Observation Platform and Hirakubozaki Lighthouse before traveling west along the north coast to Kabira.
sources.shortName: Your Search for an Ishigaki Itinerary Ends Today

places.name: Tamatorizaki Observation Platform

reviews.text: Wow, simply beautiful.  Large parking area and a long stroll to observation deck.  Elevated view, many stairs.  Also amazing flora and hiking paths requiring moderate to strenuous abilities.  Also pretty good views from the parking area if you have restrictions.  Our guide Yurika was SO kind and shared her vast knowledge of Okinawa, her love of people and her recipes.  Thank you Yuri!

Maybe because it was a cloudy day, there weren't many people around. There's no parking fee, and there aren't really any convenience facilities nearby.
However, the overall natural scenery and the driving route are so beautiful that I highly recommend it.

Amazing views looking both north and south along the east coast of the island. The brush and trees have been cut back so the views are unimpeded. There is also a very nice amount of landscaping and flowers with paved paths to explore. Definitely worth stopping to visit if you're in the area.

places.generalDescription: Fusaki Beach, located on Ishigaki Island, is part of the Fusaki Resort Village and offers a range of ocean activities and water sports equipment rentals. The beach is open from late March to October and features a lifeguard on duty as well as anti-jellyfish nets for safety. Visitors can enjoy snorkeling tours and observe various marine creatures such as sea turtles and manta rays.

sources.snippet: I wasn’t really expecting much from a beach whose most positive reviews were along the lines of ‘not spectacular, not bad’, but Maesato beach was beautiful, and much better than the second nearest Fusaki beach, whose murky water was overrun by clumps of seaweed and screaming children. Once you navigate past the confusing ‘visitors entrance’ of the hotel attached, you’ll find a path lined by tangled palm trees and pineapples ready to drop, ending in bright blue water and white sand. Like many of the swimmable beaches in Ishigaki, Maesato has a netted area to fence off the lethal box jellyfish that return every summer.
sources.shortName: Okinawa Beaches and Island time in Ishigaki

sources.snippet: Part of the Fusaki Resort Village, this public beach welcomes all visitors, and offers snorkeling tours and other ocean activities as well as watersport equipment rentals. Open from late March to October, Fusaki Beach has a lifeguard on duty and anti-jellyfish nets keeping out unpleasant marine life, so you can relax in knowing your ocean experience will be a safe one. The gorgeous sunsets are also not to be missed.
sources.shortName: 20 Fun Things to Do On Ishigaki Island, Okinawa - Places to Go, Local Food & Sightseeing Tips

sources.snippet: Located in Fusaki Resort Village, the beach is open to non-guests and is popular for marine leisure activities, including dragon boat and snorkeling equipment rentals (for a fee). From the beach, you can see Iriomote Island and Kohama Island, and the sunset is spectacular!. It is a recommended beach for a relaxing time.
sources.shortName: 八重山諸島に点在する美景ビーチ30選 | 石垣島ツアーズ

sources.snippet: Fusaki Beach—directly west of Ishigaki City—is known for its fabulous sunsets, but its sun-drenched days are just as impressive. Jellyfish can be an unwelcome hazard when swimming in the summer months in Okinawa, but at Fusaki Beach there is a safety net around the bay to keep them out.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island | Okinawa | Okinawa | Destinations | Travel Japan

sources.snippet: Fusaki Beach is accessible via the Fusaki Resort Village, so it's quite a commercial beach. The thing I liked is that they have safety nets in place so I didn't need to panic about deadly jellyfish. You can do various water activities here like kayaking or jet skiing.
sources.siteName: OMAKASE - Japan Tours, Trip, Travel Guide -
sources.shortName: My Tropical Paradise - Ishigaki Island : Blog（test） | OMAKASE

sources.snippet:
A beach facing Nagura Bay, the largest bay on Ishigaki Island
is. Fusaki Beach 
teeth
Inside "Fusaki Beach Resort Hotel & Villas" 
Although it is in
Available to non-guests
.. It is a popular tourist spot not only for locals but also for tourists.
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Summary of recommended beaches and activities on Ishigaki Island

sources.snippet: In that respect, I thought it was a beach that didn't look like Ishigaki Island. It is a popular spot to watch the sunset. With a large resort hotel and a long pier with a bell, the beach has a typical tropical resort feel.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island Recommended Beach List

sources.snippet: Fusaki beach** can be reached through Fusaki beach resort on the west side of Ishigaki. It has a picturesque pier and Fusaki resort restaurants close by.
sources.siteName: DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands - Travel tips for your travel to Japan
sources.shortName: Beaches in the Yaeyama archipelago - DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands

places.name: Fusaki Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach with a swimming area. We brought our own blanket and towels and set up on the beach by the hotel chairs. Luckily there were a few clouds to block the sun at times.

An absolutely beautiful beach with a resort nearby. A great place to enjoy a swim in the large fenced area (free of jellyfish) or a walk along the beach or pier. Also, feel free to take advantage of the bar and seating the resort offers nearby. This beach features a spectacular view of the sunrise or sunset. Be mindful to wear flip flops on the beach as the sand is littered with crushed, sharp coral bits. Only drawback, but overall an amazing beach with beautiful views.

Below the reach of extravagant resorts such as Club Med, this private beach offers an exclusive experience for those seeking a touch of a little luxury. The tranquil atmosphere, combined with the unspoilt surroundings, provides the perfect escape for those looking to indulge in a little extravagance. It's a place where you can enjoy a peaceful retreat with a touch of first class service, making it a hidden gem for those who appreciate the finer things in life.

places.generalDescription: Sukuji Beach is a hidden gem on the island, offering a kilometer-long shoreline with fine sand and clear waters. It's an ideal spot for sunbathing and leisurely dips in the shallow beach. The area is equipped with amenities like public changing rooms, showers, and restrooms for visitors' convenience. Snorkeling enthusiasts can explore the diverse marine life, including hard corals, tropical fish, sea turtles, and manta rays.

sources.snippet: It is located at the north east of the island, 5 km away from the famous Kariba Bay. It is somehow the most famous beach of the island but due to the fact that there are jellyfishes and only a small part of the beach protected by jellyfish net is swimmable , it is not our number 1 swimming option, still deserves a visit.
sources.shortName: Discover Ishigaki, Iriomote, Taketomi, Yonaguni or Hateruma

sources.snippet: A couple of kilometers from Kabira Bay there is Sukuji Beach, a white-sand cove with a small pine forest equipped with toilets and showers. The water is so clear that you might see starfish on the sandy bottom, please remember not to touch them and do not remove them absolutely from the water!
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island, the southern side of Okinawa

sources.snippet: After the boat ride, I walked half an hour to the nearest beach, Sukuji. This was one of my favourite beaches of the trip, partly because of the walk there, which wound through farmland and thick patches of jungle with the faint, sickly sweet scent of rotten fruit hanging in the air.
sources.shortName: Okinawa Beaches and Island time in Ishigaki

sources.snippet: This family-friendly beach is wide and shallow with gentle waves, and its white sand stretches for nearly a kilometer. The picturesque scenery reaches all the way to forested Cape Kabiraishi, whose dark green color contrasts beautifully with the turquoise ocean. Sukuji Bathing Beach
sources.shortName: 20 Fun Things to Do On Ishigaki Island, Okinawa - Places to Go, Local Food & Sightseeing Tips

sources.snippet: Kabira Bay is one of the popular tourist spots and is home to the island’s most famous beach – Yonehara beach. This beach offers some of the great diving and snorkelling sites amidst white coral reefs. Swimming, diving and snorkelling are strictly not allowed in the Kabira Bay.
sources.shortName: Best Beach of Japan for Tourists: Ishigaki Island, The Hidden Holm

sources.snippet: It is a popular spot with children because of the comfortable shade of the trees. Since it is difficult to swim at low tide, a relaxing nap under the shade of the mokumao trees that line the edge of the beach is also pleasant. The view from the beach is also spectacular.
sources.shortName: 八重山諸島に点在する美景ビーチ30選 | 石垣島ツアーズ

sources.snippet: This beach is netted so you don't need to worry about dangerous marine life. The sand isn't the best as it has some shells/coral but it isn't too bad. There is a lot of shade from the trees right next to the sand which was great for someone who burns easily like me.
sources.siteName: OMAKASE - Japan Tours, Trip, Travel Guide -
sources.shortName: My Tropical Paradise - Ishigaki Island : Blog（test） | OMAKASE

sources.snippet: Up in the northwest corner of Ishigaki Island, you'll come to Sukuji Beach, set in a graceful bay surrounded by trees. If you're traveling with young children, this is the ideal beach to visit. The water is very shallow, and the seabed is sandy.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island | Okinawa | Okinawa | Destinations | Travel Japan

sources.snippet:
Characterized by a coastline that stretches like a large bow
is. Land (lottery) beach 
of 
The length is about 1km
.. One of Ishigaki Island's representative long beaches with a beautiful gradation of blue and emerald green
..
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Summary of recommended beaches and activities on Ishigaki Island

sources.snippet: The beach is located in the Kabira neighbourhood, inside a bay. This is probably why waters are particularly warm. In summer time, a net is used to prevent the jellyfish to pass.
sources.shortName: Closest beaches | vacances a la mer Ishigaki

places.name: Sukuji Beach

reviews.text: A small, quiet beach close to the famous Kabira Bay with stunningly clear waters. Never crowded, ideal for families with children. Free parking, showers, toilets and shop. No pushy tourist traps - just pure charm.
Water is lukewarm but it has a netted off area where it‘s safe to swim. The lifeguards are really cute, one guy caught a big box jellyfish outside the net and showed it to us.
Scenic but st low tide not even worth going in. The net to protect from stingers is then flat on the ground. Nice shaded setting.

places.generalDescription: Taketomi Island is a picturesque destination with tranquil beaches and a delightful village adorned with red-tiled roof buildings. Visitors can enjoy snorkeling among vibrant tropical fish or embark on a hike to Mount Omoto for breathtaking views. The area also offers opportunities to explore Okinawan culture and traditions, from ancient human remains at the Yaeyama Museum to learning Okinawan dance moves at Yaema Village.

sources.snippet: You can wrap it around you to keep you warm after you bound across the pristine reefs; you can lie on it on the brilliant star sand beach of Taketomi; you can sleep under it during the hotter hours of the day; you can use it as a sail if you get tired while doing stand-up paddle boarding; swing it around like a crazy person to fight off those pesky mosquitoes; wrap it around your head to look silly; you can wave it as a distress signal, and of course you can dry yourself with it if you happen to get wet while snorkeling.
sources.shortName: Snorkeling | Visit Ishigaki

sources.snippet: Taketomi Island’s living heritage is a fascinating glimpse into traditional island customs. This coral-fenced village is kept alive not only by the daily buzz of day-tripping tourists, but by the proud and resilient attitude of its residents. Taketomi is best when it’s sunny (some other islands have jungles, which are perfect for cloudy days), so check the weather before heading out.
sources.shortName: 10 Top Tips for Ishigaki Exploration

sources.snippet: On Taketomi you can ride in a cart pulled by a water buffalo. The buffalo will slowly take you on a meander around the island, allowing you to peacefully gaze at the wonderful preserved Ryukyu village. You can also rent bicycles and cycle around yourself.
sources.siteName: OMAKASE - Japan Tours, Trip, Travel Guide -
sources.shortName: My Tropical Paradise - Ishigaki Island : Blog（test） | OMAKASE

sources.snippet: While most day-trippers head to bucolic Taketomi Island, famous for its water buffalo, other options exist. Most alluringly, the somewhat far away Hateruma Island offers what are probably the best beaches in Ishigaki apart from Kabira Bay itself.
sources.shortName: Your Search for an Ishigaki Itinerary Ends Today

sources.siteName: DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands - Travel tips for your travel to Japan
sources.shortName: Beaches in the Yaeyama archipelago - DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands

places.name: Taketomi Island

reviews.text: Very peaceful Island.about 15 minutes away from Ishigaki Island. The Island have several nice beaches.several small cafe and restaurant have there. Visitors can rent bicycles.you can spend a few hours to see everything.Good place to relax.

The island offers a wonderfully authentic look at remote life, with charming traditional homes that feel very real. It's a little worrying, though, that the entire residential area seems to be on display, raising questions about privacy. Still, a memorable visit.

The island is a paradise. Not big but is full worth a day or 2, you can visit the jungle , swim in the crystal clear waters, admire the big trees close to the shore , and see the life of the locals.  Just remember to take sun screen even if it is not a shiny day.

places.generalDescription: Shiraho Beach is a serene and picturesque destination offering glass-bottom boat trips, snorkeling, and diving opportunities to explore its extensive blue coral reefs. It is known for its well-tended and supervised environment, making it ideal for families with young children. The beach boasts over 120 varieties of corals, including the impressive stone coral, the largest in the northern hemisphere. While not suitable for swimming due to its wild nature and large stones, it offers a unique setting for photography enthusiasts.

sources.snippet:
A beautiful natural beach with white white beaches extending for about 10km
is.

About 20 minutes by car from Ishigaki Airport (New Ishigakijima Airport). On the way to the city
Therefore, it is easy to stop by and has good access. Shiraho coast 
The feature of
The world's largest colony of blue coral
That is.

Besides blue coral, Poritidae, Montipora foliosa, etc. 
Inhabited by over 120 species of coral and over 300 species of colorful fish
doing.
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Summary of recommended beaches and activities on Ishigaki Island

sources.snippet: Shiraho Beach is located between Ishigaki Airport and the center of Ishigaki City (port), so visitors to Ishigaki Island almost always pass right next to it. It is famous as a colony of blue coral that looks like a collection of twigs. There are more pictures of underwater corals on the internet than pictures of the beach.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island Recommended Beach List

sources.snippet: This beautiful beach is home to a colony of blue coral, a globally precious species. Glass boats and snorkelers can observe the mysterious blue coral. Shiraho Coast is famous for its sea where more than 350 types of corals, including blue corals, can be seen.
sources.shortName: 八重山諸島に点在する美景ビーチ30選 | 石垣島ツアーズ

places.name: Shiraho Beach

reviews.text: Quiet, peaceful, a few families and local people enjoying the beach and warm water. There are only 4 official parking spaces, but several people parked around the covered area.

The parking space is limited, but it's more appealing because it's not crowded with visitors.
Caution: You have to go through residential areas, so watch out for people who might suddenly appear!
I spent my time here until I waited for the flight on the last day of my trip to Ishigaki Island.It was the best on the pristine beach with nothing.

places.generalDescription: Maesato Beach is a picturesque spot on Ishigaki Island, known for its azure waters and white sand. It's backed by the modern ANA InterContinental Ishigaki Resort, offering guests direct access to the beach. The area is celebrated for its rare blue coral reef of Shiraho, making it one of Japan's best diving spots. Visitors can enjoy swimming and snorkeling in the super clear water or take a walk along the coast during both sunshine and sunset.

sources.snippet: Maesato Beach is located in front of "ANA Intercontinental Ishigaki Resort". At first glance, it looks like a private hotel beach, but it can be used by non-guests without permission. Maesato Beach is conveniently located about 5 minutes by car from the city center, and is recommended for families and female travelers who want to enjoy the ocean in a safe and secure environment.
sources.shortName: 石垣島の絶景ビーチ30選！穴場から人気の定番ビーチまで現地在住スタッフが紹介 | 石垣島ツアーズ

sources.snippet: The closest (non-manmade) beach to Ishigaki port, where most of the cheaper accommodations are located, is called Maesato beach – about a 20-minute cycle, or a 10-minute bus ride if you want to brave the sparse timetables. Luckily, my hostel rented out bikes – albeit very small, slightly comical looking bikes – to explore the island at will.
sources.shortName: Okinawa Beaches and Island time in Ishigaki

sources.snippet: The beach located next to Intercontinental Hotel is the closest beach from Ishigaki city and you can reach it with a 20 minutes bus drive if you do not have a car. It is not the most impressive beach of the island but you will find white sand and clear water.
sources.shortName: Discover Ishigaki, Iriomote, Taketomi, Yonaguni or Hateruma

sources.snippet: Maesato Beach in the south has lifeguards and an array of facilities and activities. It is one of the closest beaches from Ishigaki Port.
sources.siteName: VISIT OKINAWA JAPAN | Official Okinawa Travel Guide
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Island | VISIT OKINAWA JAPAN

places.name: Maesato Beach

reviews.text: I'd your a hotel guest at the ana hotel. This beach I would say is the best of beaches I've visited. I haven't found many rocks. And there are even people that I've seen who swim around taking rocks and garbage out of the ocean. And beach. And personally I've not seen garbage on the beach. So if your staying at the ana hotel, which is also very good. I would definitely recommend going here. Also just for context I belive it wins over the beaches at the main Okinawa island and beaches at Thailand especially over the surin beach. Also the night sky is beautiful, and there are lots of nice small cute hermit crabs at night or big, huge ones closer to the forest.

Beautiful beach with swimming area, floating water playground and lifeguard. We rented chairs and an umbrella from the hotel beach staff and stayed all day. The floating water playground, umbrella and chairs are an additional charge of your not a hotel guest. The beach area has no shade. The swimming area a large and the water is warm. We wear water shoes to avoid rocks and shells in the water.

Nestled along the stunning coastline, this beach next to ANA Intercontinental Hotel is a vibrant hub of activity and relaxation. The soft white sands stretch along the shore, creating a picturesque setting for beachgoers.

There is a floating water park that promises endless fun. Colorful inflatable structures bob on the water, enticing adventurous spirits to climb, jump, and slide. Nearby, a sign informs visitors about rental options for parasols and chairs, ensuring everyone can find comfort under the sun.

The beach is part of the luxurious ANA InterContinental Ishigaki Resort, blending relaxation with upscale amenities. Guests can indulge in beachside services, enhancing their experience with refreshments and leisure activities. The atmosphere is lively, with people engaging in beach games, swimming, and soaking up the serene surroundings.

places.generalDescription: If you're looking for an unforgettable aquatic adventure, look no further than Sounds of the Sea Canoe & Kayak Rentals in Kabira Bay. This stunning location offers a unique opportunity to paddle through crystal-clear waters while soaking up the breathtaking scenery. You can embark on exciting canoe and kayak tours that include complimentary photo sessions and even snorkeling excursions on uninhabited islands. Families will find plenty to enjoy here, as evidenced by one family's delightful experience over two days filled with snorkeling and mangrove kayaking.

sources.snippet:
The nature of Kabira Bay 
Feel close to the surface of the water 
be able to
Canoe / kayak tour
.. You can enjoy great deals such as free photo tours and tours where you can enjoy snorkeling by landing on an uninhabited island in Kabira Bay. ☆ Super Summer Sale ☆ [Okinawa Ishigaki Island] From Kabira Bay!
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Summary of recommended beaches and activities on Ishigaki Island

places.name: Sounds of the Sea Canoe & Kayak Rentals

reviews.text: Thank you so much for the amazing kayak tour. He was able to show us many things even though we don't speak Japanese and was super nice. It was also very nice that he took so many pictures of us.
We had a great time kayaking and snorkling! At first we only wanted to do one activity, but in the end we were glad we did both - the 3 hours flew by so quickly!

Early morning fishing trip with the wonderful Maruyama San. A little rough out where the South China Sea meets the Pacific - but a great adventure. Clean well equipped boat, friendly service, plenty of fish.

places.generalDescription: Yonehara Beach is a natural sandy beach known for its vibrant marine life, making it a popular spot for snorkeling. The coral reefs are easily accessible from the shore, offering clear waters teeming with colorful fish. Visitors are advised to be cautious of currents and Habu jellyfish. The beach provides amenities such as a parking lot and restrooms. However, due to its popularity, it can get crowded, so arriving early is recommended.
places.name: Yonehara Beach

reviews.text:
The best snorkeling beach in Okinawa! I've been to many islands, but this one is the far best! So many corals right off the beach!  Water is so clear that you can see fish without swimming!
It was so many corals and hard to swim through. It was really sad to see families and kids were standing on the corals I really hope people don't destroy corals to preserve beautiful beach 😢
Go early as it gets busy. We went on Monday around 10:00 in July, but it was already busy. Only few spots for free parking. Rest is 500 yen. Shower is ¥300, so you might want to bring water to rinse yourself.

Although the beach is said to be beautiful, beware of the numerous car parks around it, which seem designed to exploit tourists. It's easy to be misled and getting to the beach can be a challenge. A top spot to avoid.

The beach itself is not so special, by far not the most beautiful one. But it's a must do if you like snorkeling. You can rent the equipment, the access is easy and the reef is gorgeous, you just need to get in 10m and the variety of fish is impressive. Great spot for snorkeling, for beaching not so special tho.

places.generalDescription: Gran ping Resort Yokabushi, formerly known as Hermitage, is an upscale hotel with chic villas and a relaxing atmosphere. It is located beside Tamatorizaki South Beach and features a beautiful central pool. The accommodation options include self-contained apartments in the main building and standalone Okinawan-style cottages. Guests can enjoy modern amenities, outstanding service, free WiFi, and delicious dining options at the on-site restaurant.

sources.snippet: A lovely boutique hotel set beside Tamatorizaki South Beach, with a beautiful central pool. There are self-contained 2nd floor apartments with big rooms and proper kitchens in the main building and stand-alone Okinawan-style cottages with kitchenettes. It’s modern, clean, and the service is outstanding.
sources.siteName: Islands of Japan - Travel Tips by Ippei and Janine
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Travel Guide & Tips

places.name: Glamping Resort Yokabushi (formerly Hermitage)

reviews.text:
The room is big and even has a small, private patio. The bathtub in the room is very comfortable. Breakfast is a set meal, so if you're used to eating a lot in the morning you might consider an early lunch.

They have a laundry room in the premises, but the dryers aren't that good. Luckily there's plenty of sun to dry the clothes.

Amazing lodging. The apartment we stayed in was very comfortable and spacious, equipped with all the basics and very clean. The hotel grounds was very peaceful and even has a small, pleasant swimming pool.

The breakfast is a western style set, and it was delicious but unfortunately quite modest in size and can leave you wanting.

The optional BBQ set where you rent grilling gear in their grilling ground and receive meats to prepare was an incredibly fun and tasty experience.

The location of the hotel is a little far off so it's worth having a car, and even then travel times can be a little long to different parts of the island.

The place is  beautiful and the rooms are spacious. There is a pool and you can go down to the beach... but value for money is not given here.
The rooms will not be cleaned during your stay which I personally think is not nice as the floor is made from tiles and they start to be sticky on the second day. Also there is no broom or other cleaning accessories, so there is no way you can keep it clean yourselves.
Breakfast is needed to book extra, also the bbq needs to be booked extra and you can only buy the course the hotel offers (so you can't bring your own food).
The beach (which was mentioned in the advertising) was unfortunately not maintained and pretty dirty with all kinds of plastic trash that have washed ashore. Yes it's not their fault, but we went to a different resort too and they cleaned the beach perfectly.
Even tough it is a really nice place, all in all my expectations were not fulfilled.

places.generalDescription: Tabaga Beach, also known as Kabira Tabaga Beach, is a hidden gem located near Club Med in Kabira Bay. Accessible via a small unmarked road, this secluded beach offers a peaceful and local atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful sunrise and excellent snorkeling opportunities with clear waters that remain relatively shallow for about a mile out. While the beach is isolated and pristine, it's important to be cautious of algae and insects in certain areas.

sources.snippet: Kabira Tabaga Beach is a fairly local and peaceful beach that I highly recommend. Head towards Club Med (Kabira Bay to the back) then turn right onto a small road. The beach is down that small unmarked road.
sources.siteName: OMAKASE - Japan Tours, Trip, Travel Guide -
sources.shortName: My Tropical Paradise - Ishigaki Island : Blog（test） | OMAKASE
Closest beaches | vacances a la mer Ishigaki

places.name: Tabaga beach

reviews.text: Amazing beach, great for swimming, snorkeling not so much. Unfortunately lots of Japanese people come here to do photoshootings and are using drones which is extremely annoying and disrespectful for other visitors. Disallowing drones on this beach would really help to maintain the beauty and tranquility of this place. Be aware of crows that try to steal stuff from your bag.
It is a great place for snorkelling and adventures. You could walk from club med to here through some rocky biomes, but not too long time.

It takes a bit of finding and is off the beaten path but this beach is so good. Very close to guesthouse Iriwa if you're staying there. You can see peacocks on the way if you go early and quiet enough. It's isolated so there's hardly every anyone here but it's still a beautiful beach, especially the view. Great place to watch the sun rise, and also the snorkeling is really good, the water stays around 6-10 foot deep for at least a mile or so out. I didn't feel in any danger swimming way out, and the further you go the more you see. Lots of fish, and I even saw a sea turtle, needle fish, puffer fish, and a small sea snake. The beach itself has some trash on it but that seems unfortunately more do do with the current and ocean trash washing ashore than littering guests. Still, the water and reef are clean.
